For competition assays, test tubes containing 350 µL of intermediate solution ([3H]-prazosin 0.16 nM, 1.6 mM 
EDTA
, 50 mM 
Tris
 (pH 7.4 at 25°C)) it was added the 50 µL of different concentrations of LDT's (end concentration 10-9 - 10-4 M) or 50 µL of water (solvent for dilution of LDT's) for the determination of total binding or 50 µL nonradioactive 
prazosin
 at 10 µM (end 1 µM) to the determination of nonspecific binding, and 200 µg of membrane preparations of rabbit liver (α1A) contained in 50 µL suspension completing end volume of 500 µL.
Binding of [3H]-prazosin to α1B adrenoceptorsBinding assays were standardized for α1B adrenoceptors in the same way adrenoceptor binding assays for α1A according to the literature, i.e. saturation and competition assays were performed on membrane preparations from rat liver, in this case using 150 g protein per tube contained 50 Ml suspension, in addition to various concentrations of LDT's (10-9 - 10-6 M)

Here are the extracted sentences with bioactivity metrics (IC50, Ki, KB, Kd, EC50) along with specific numeric values and units:

1. The values of Kd and Bmax were 2.05 ± 0.28 nM and 124 ± 7 fmol / mg protein (n = 1), respectively.
2. The values of Kd and Bmax were 0.7 ± 0.1 nM and 125 ± 42 fmol / mg protein, respectively (Neves et al., Bioorg Med. Chem. 18 (5): 1925-1935, 2010).
3. We conducted experiments with BMY7378 50 nM, α1D adrenoceptor antagonist used as positive control, and obtained a value of KB = 2.95 nM, consistent with the literature (CARROLL et al, Bioorg Med Chem Lett, 11:1119 - 1121, 2001).
4. The KB values individually calculated and obtained from the functional experiments in the presence of LDT OR BMY7378 at 50 nM, b10 nM or c2 nM.
5. Kd values of [3H]-prazosin to α1A adrenoceptors were 0.46 nM and 56.5 nM for sites with high and low affinities, respectively (n = 3), and α1B adrenoceptors the Kd value was 0,34 nM (n = 3), in agreement with literature (SHIBATA and cols., Mol. Pharmacol., 48:250-258, 1995).
6. The Kd value was used to calculate Ki of LDT's using the Cheng-Prusoff equation, where for prazosin (PZS) Kd values were 0.46 nM and 56.5 nM for sites of high and low affinity, respectively to α1A adrenoceptor, and it was used Kd = 0.34 nM for α1B-adrenoceptor.
7. The Ki obtained values were summarized in the following Tables 3 to 5 below.
8. Table 3: pharmacological parameters of the LDT's (2-6 and 8) in the α1A-adrenoceptors, with Ki values ranging from 1.57 x 10-8 to 2.16 x 10-9 M.
9. Table 4: Pharmacological Parameters of the LDT's (2-6, 8) α1B adrenoceptor, with Ki values ranging from 4.87 x 10-8 to 9.07 x 10-9 M.
10. Table 5: Pharmacological parameters of LDT' s (62-70 and 39) in α1A and α1B adrenoceptor, with Ki values ranging from 61 to 304 nM for α1A and 54 to 425 nM for α1B.
11. The Kd value of [3H]-8-OH-DPAT (Kd = 0.7 nM ± 0.1 nM) was used to calculate the Ki of the LDT's using the Cheng-Prusoff equation.
12. The Ki obtained values for 5-HT1A receptors were summarized in Tables 7 and 8, with Ki values ranging from 1.24 x 10-9 to 2.42 x 10-10 M.
13. The Kd value of [3H]-ketanserin (Kd = 1.77 ± 0.07 nM) was used to calculate the Ki of the LDT's using the Cheng-Prusoff equation.
14. The Ki obtained values for 5-HT2A receptors were summarized in Tables 10 and 11, with Ki values ranging from 1.72 to 40.4 nM.
15. The IC50 values were calculated by non-linear regression using GraphPad Prism software (USA) and expressed as mean ± EPM, with IC50 values ranging from 4.26 to 7.91 for muscarinic receptors and 6.73 to 7.91 for D2 dopaminergic receptors.
